main event: A bright white star-like object was observed moving to the east in Arlington, Texas on July 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object exhibited erratic motion, moving up and down as well as right and left, The observer reported that the object appeared to be the tail star of the Big Dipper at one point, The sighting lasted for approximately 10-15 minutes, The observation raised questions about atmospheric disturbances affecting radar readings, No physical evidence was found to confirm the sighting as anything other than an aircraft.
